newsitem.title: FRANCE: French stocks open a touch higher, focus on BoF.
newsitem.headline: French stocks open a touch higher, focus on BoF.

text.p: French stocks opened slightly higher on Thursday on expectations that the Bank of France may cut interest rates later in the day.
The blue-chip CAC-40 index was up 17.86 points or 0.75 percent at 2,405.84 at 1030 GMT while the CAC-40 futures contract rose 18 points to 2,409. Volume was 906 million francs.

Trading was expected to stay quiet ahead of a Bank of France policy setting meeting. Dealers and economists said they expected the Bank to trim the intervention rate by five basis points to 3.10 percent. The meeting ends at about 1215 GMT.
Cap Gemini shares were up sharply on a resurgence of rumours that Daimler unit Debis SH would significantly increase its stake in the French computer services company.
The rumour holds that Debis would offer 300 francs per share to increase its stake from 24.4 percent to about 50 percent.
At 1035 GMT, Cap Gemini shares were up 4.64 percent at 268.60 francs after reaching a high of 271 francs earlier. Daimler shares were down 2.70 at 114.20 marks.

Havas was up 0.57 percent at 391.20 francs after newspapers reported it would make an offer to buy out CEP minority shareholders after the market close on Thursday. CEP shares were suspended. Havas declined to comment.
Bic shares climbed 3.54 percent to 195 francs after announcing a rise in sales and increased activity in the fourth quarter.
